text: Great comprehensive list of the amazing amount of duplicated work that has been done :stuck_out_tongue:

elements.text: Great comprehensive list of the amazing amount of duplicated work that has been done

text:
It is good to have a central place to identify candidate packages for a project - but I also note the suggestion to compare “each package yourself” :scream: .  I understand the spirit of this, but, whew, when I just need to complete a task, having even more options to check than before is a bit intimidating :simple_smile:

Also, in the spirit of helping, under finite differencing I saw a small typo, “deriviatives”

text:
>  also, in the spirit of helping, under finite differencing I saw a small typo, “deriviatives”
Want to make a quick PR?

elements.text: also, in the spirit of helping, under finite differencing I saw a small typo, “deriviatives”
Want to make a quick PR?

text:
>  but I also note the suggestion to compare “each package yourself” :scream: .  I understand the spirit of this, but, whew, when I just need to complete a task, having even more options to check than before is a bit intimidating :simple_smile:
It was be a massive tome of a page if tried to comprehensively cover differences and similarities.
and any attempt to make it concise would likely end-up glossing over something and making the author mad.

In general I recommend asking here.
then I can say things like “You only dealing with Matrix? No? Zygote or Nabla. yes? Zygote or ReverseDiff, depends doing getindex a lot? prob ReverseDiff then”

elements.text: but I also note the suggestion to compare “each package yourself”
.  I understand the spirit of this, but, whew, when I just need to complete a task, having even more options to check than before is a bit intimidating

It was be a massive tome of a page if tried to comprehensively cover differences and similarities.
and any attempt to make it concise would likely end-up glossing over something and making the author mad.

In general I recommend asking here.
then I can say things like “You only dealing with Matrix? No? Zygote or Nabla. yes? Zygote or ReverseDiff, depends doing getindex a lot? prob ReverseDiff then”

text:
thanks for the reply - your comments make complete sense, and even neglecting the weight of the resulting tome (when printed) it would, as you note, be very difficult to give a truly balanced comparison.

regarding PR, it would be a good exercise for me - but I’ll have to concede I’m not sure how to go about this - what repository has this site text/code?   I can quickly go to <https://github.com/JuliaDiff> but where to look next is not clear.  Might be faster for you to fix :slightly_smiling_face:
